question:
To incur which of the following kinds of expenditures, the government needs to get an Appropriation Act passed in parliament?
  1. Votable expenditures
  2. Non-votable expenditures
  3. Vote on Account
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: This bill is required to be passed for votable as well as non-votable expenditures. When a government presents Vote on Account as a part of its Budget exercise; two appropriation bills viz. Appropriation (Vote on Account) Bill and Appropriation Bill of that year are passed.
